alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, Bradford, central Alachua, north central Marion, southern Baker, northwestern Putnam, Union, Clay, southwestern Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Gainesville Airport, or 8 miles north of Gainesville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Starke, Lake Butler, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Raiford, Worthington Spring, Melrose, Fort McCoy and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
